document_title: Interstitial cystitis: Causes, symptoms and treatment
subsection_content:
If patients with interstitial cystitis do not detect the disease early and receive timely treatment intervention, they will face a number of complications of the disease. Although complications do not directly affect life or are classified as dangerous diseases, they still cause significant inconvenience to the patient's life and reduce the patient's health.
Potential complications of interstitial cystitis that you need to be aware of:
Reduced bladder capacity: Interstitial cystitis can make the bladder wall thicker and harder. Leads to limiting the amount of water that can be held in the bladder.; Reduced quality of life: Pain and frequent urination become factors that cause obstacles in your daily activities and work.; Inconvenience during sex: Pain in the pelvic area and pubic bone will get worse during sex. This becomes the reason why the patient is reluctant to have sex, or even reduces the need for sex.; Mental health problems: Patients may experience stress and difficulty controlling emotions because of chronic pain and insomnia caused by interstitial cystitis. In some cases, people are likely to face depression if stress and emotional disturbances persist.
